jobs.title: Business Analyst
jobs.description:
Job Description: Manager Business Analytics (Marketing)

Role Overview




We are looking for a Manager Business Analytics to support the Marketing function in driving data-led decision-making across marketing and revenue functions. The role combines insight generation, customer & revenue analytics, pricing intelligence, and MIS building to enable smarter strategies, sharper execution, and measurable growth.

Key Responsibilities




1. Marketing & Customer Analytics

Analyze customer acquisition, retention, and churn to recommend actionable reactivation, upsell, and cross-sell strategies.
Build segmentation frameworks to identify high-value customers and drive lifetime value (LTV).
Evaluate digital and offline campaign performance, providing insights to optimize ROI and reduce CAC.
Track marketing funnel KPIs (awareness, consideration, conversion, loyalty) and recommend interventions.

2. Revenue & Commercial Insights

Conduct competitor and market pricing analysis to support product and package pricing decisions.
Analyze sales performance by geography, channel, and product line to identify growth levers.
Partner with channel and distribution teams to track KPIs, improve alignment, and drive revenue achievement.

3. Decision Support

Prepare monthly and quarterly business reviews and presentations for the function and leadership team.
Translate complex data into simple, actionable insights for marketing, product, and revenue decisions.
Build forward-looking models (predictive trends, scenario planning) to highlight opportunities and risks.
Act as a thought partner in shaping marketing and revenue strategy.

4. MIS & Reporting Enablement

Design and maintain centralized MIS dashboards for sales, revenue, and marketing performance.
Collaborate with MIS Teams to automate reporting systems, reducing manual effort and improving accuracy.
Standardize customer and revenue data to improve reliability, visibility, and control.
Build early-warning reports on receivables and revenue leakage to mitigate business risks.

Desired Candidate Profile



Education: MBA/PGDM (Marketing/Analytics/Strategy) or equivalent.
Experience: 6–7 years in business analytics, marketing analytics, or commercial insights, ideally in healthcare, consumer services, or e-commerce.
Strong proficiency in SQL/Excel and data visualization tools (Quicksight, Power BI, Tableau, or equivalent).
Solid understanding of marketing and revenue metrics (CAC, LTV, CTR, ROI, funnel performance).
Exposure to pricing analytics, customer segmentation, and MIS/reporting automation.
Ability to simplify data into compelling business narratives for CXO-level stakeholders.

Job Location: PAN India

Your Role

As an AEM Business Analyst, you will serve as the bridge between business stakeholders and the technical development team, ensuring that Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) solutions align with business goals. You will be responsible for gathering requirements, analyzing business processes, and translating them into functional specifications for AEM-based digital experiences.

In This Role, You Will Play a Key Role In:

Collaborating with business stakeholders to understand digital experience goals and translate them into AEM requirements.
Leading requirement-gathering sessions, documenting user stories, and defining acceptance criteria.
Working closely with UX/UI designers, developers, and QA teams to ensure successful delivery of AEM solutions.
Supporting the product owner in backlog grooming, sprint planning, and prioritization.
Conducting gap analysis and identifying opportunities for process improvement using AEM capabilities.
Assisting in UAT (User Acceptance Testing) and ensuring solutions meet business expectations.
Staying updated on AEM features and best practices to guide stakeholders on platform capabilities.

Top 5 Technical Skills

Adobe Experience Manager (AEM) Deep understanding of AEM Sites, Assets, Workflows, and Components.
Business Analysis & Requirements Gathering – Expertise in creating BRDs, FRDs, user stories, and process flows.
Agile/Scrum Methodologies – Experience working in Agile environments with tools like JIRA or Azure DevOps.
Content Management Systems (CMS) – Familiarity with CMS concepts, digital asset management, and content lifecycle.
Data Analysis & Reporting – Ability to interpret analytics and user behavior to inform business decisions (e.g., Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics).



What you'll love about working here:

You can shape your career with us. We offer a range of career paths and internal opportunities within Capgemini group. You will also get personalized career guidance from our leaders.
You will get comprehensive wellness benefits including health checks, telemedicine, insurance with top-ups, elder care, partner coverage or new parent support via flexible work.
At Capgemini, you can work on cutting-edge projects in tech and engineering with industry leaders or create solutions to overcome societal and environmental challenges.
